H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H8254.def: = action by which humans determine the weight of an object, which is usually done with the help of a balance (scales)

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1962.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H3976.def: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H2344.def: = minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea-shore, river-beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H1161.def: = state in which someone experiences an overwhelming fear

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H5101.def: = action by which humans and animals produce a loud, harsh cry

H1877.def: = a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1600.def: = to make the characteristic deep sustained sound of a cow

H1098.def: = mixture ◄ consisting of entire plants, including leaves, stalks, and grain; ► served as food for domestic animals

H8602.def: = food that does not have much taste ◄ due to the lack of salt

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H4417.def: = white crystalline substance, mainly consisting of sodium chloride; ► normally used for seasoning or preserving food; ≈ associated with infertility of the soil but also with permanence

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2940.def: = the flavor characteristics of certain types of food

H2495.def: = either: purslane, a plant with a thick slimy juice, or: mallow, a bushy shrub with oval leaves, of which the buds and the young leaves are edible; ◄ |iSuaeda asphaltica |i*or |iAtriplex halimus|i*; ► may serve as food; ≈ regarded as not very tasty

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3985.def: = state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7596.def: = action by which humans experience a desire for something to happen and communicate this to (other) humans or deities in the hope that they will intenvene on their behalf

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2974.def: = to be and/or behave like one with little insight, education or wisdom; ≈ pejorative (see the related term {L:אִוֶּלֶת<SDBH:אִוֶּלֶת>})

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1214.def: = causative action by which someone severs a link between one object and a larger object of which it used to be a part

H5165.def: = state in which humans experience relief after a period of stress, ◄ due to various possible reasons

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H748.def: = to be long or to increase in length

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H5080.def: = state in which one's hand, which holds an instrument like an axe, is raised ► with the purpose of striking it against another object

H4523.def: literally: melting or molten; hence: = state in which humans have lost all courage

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H7140.def: = cold weather that develops overnight due to the drop in temperature

H7950.def: = frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

H6789.def: = process by which liquids disappear from existence, as a result of warm weather

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2215.def: = process by which ice becomes liquid ◄ as a result of a rise in temperature

H1846.def: = process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H3943.def: = action by which humans extend their arms and grope with their hands trying to find something to touch or grasp

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H8485.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}; ► regarded as founder of a nation bearing the same name

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1979.def: = action by which humans move forward, usually towards a specific destination

H7614.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Joktan<SDBH:יָקְטָן>}; descendant of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of ethnic group with the same name

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2866.def: = event that causes people to lose their inner strength and courage

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3051.def: = causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H6184.def: = state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4834.def: = process by which an event causes grief and suffering to those experiencing it

H3476.def: = state in which humans are morally and ethically right

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H2976.def: = process by which someone resigns to being unable to change a situation, and gives up trying to do so

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H2974.def: = to be and/or behave like one with little insight, education or wisdom; ≈ pejorative (see the related term {L:אִוֶּלֶת<SDBH:אִוֶּלֶת>})

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil
